content:
This is a cool clash, but the test/validators aren't strong enough to really force players to solve the problem.

I got beaten in shortest mode by someone who simply made an array of the words, then removed duplicate words from the array and printed them back out as a sentence.
This got 100% on all validators and was able to get down to only 24 characters in Ruby!

I was only able to get down to 34, because I was solving the actual problem and didn't think it could be reduced to something so much simpler.
It would be good to add a new tests/validators pair that requires some duplicate words in the output, to avoid this hack.

e.g.
Input
Fran had a friend who had several rabbits and several foxes
Output
Fran had a friend who had several rabbits and foxes

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: the puzzle is different and interesting to solve, I love it!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I found the puzzle quite fun and intuitive. Definitely solvable in the time and works for all modes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I thought the puzzle was quite easy but fun and unique. It is most definitely solvable in the clash time and works for all modes in my opinion. 

If you wanted to increase the difficulty a little bit, you could have a test case for a sentence already in proper form: "John has a cat and dog".

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
